Justification: To collect evidence related to the sexual assault, which may include swabs, hair samples, and clothing analysis.
To check for any sexually transmitted infections that may have been contracted during the assault.
To rule out pregnancy resulting from the assault.
To assess overall health and check for signs of infection or other medical issues.
To rule out HIV infection, which is a concern following sexual assault.
To check for hepatitis infections, which can be transmitted sexually.
To check for any urinary tract infections or other abnormalities.
To determine if any drugs were used to facilitate the assault.
